2312790.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312790
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 001
2312790.text: Abu'l-Malih reported from one of his people (who was a Companion) that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "When Allah wants one of His slaves to die in some land, he makes him have a reason for going there."

2312800.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312800
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 002
2312800.text: Muhammad ibn Sirin related that Abu Hurayra blew his nose in his garment and then said, "Squirt! Squirt! Abu Hurayra blows his nose in linen. You saw me lying between 'A'isha's room and the minbar when people said I was crazy, but I was only hungry."

2312810.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312810
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 003
2312810.text: Abu Hurayra related, "Some people said, 'Messenger of Allah, we feel in ourselves something which we do not want to speak about and we have been in that state since sunrise.' He said, 'Have you really felt like that?' 'Yes,' they said. He said, 'That is clear belief.'"

2312820.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312820
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 004
2312820.text: Shahr ibn Hawshab said, "Me and my maternal aunt visited 'A'isha and said, 'Sometimes something occurs to one of us such that, if he had spoken about it, that would have been the end of his hopes for the Next World. If it were to be revealed, he would be killed for it.' She said the takbir three times and then said, 'The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was asked about that and said, "If that happens to one of you, he should say the takbir three times. Only a believer feels that.'"

2312830.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312830
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 005
2312830.text: Anas ibn Malik said, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, 'People will continue to ask about things that do not exist to such an extent that they will say, "Allah created everything, so who created Allah?"'"

2312840.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312840
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 006
2312840.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Beware of suspicion. Suspicion is the worst type of lie. Do not spy. Do not fight one another. Do not try to ensnare one another (in sales). Do not envy each other. Do not hate one another. Be slaves of Allah and brothers."

2312850.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312850
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 007
2312850.text: Anas said, "While the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was with one of his wives, a man passed by and the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, called him and said, 'So-and-so, this is my wife so-and-so.' The man said, 'Whoever I might suspect, I would not suspect you!' The Prophet said, 'Shaytan flows in the son of Adam like blood flows.'"

2312860.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312860
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 008
2312860.text: 'Abdullah said, "The person who has had something stolen from him continues to be suspicious until he is worse than the thief."

2312870.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312870
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 009
2312870.text: Bilal ibn Sa'd al-Ash'ari related that Mu'awiya wrote to Abu Dharr, "Write down for me the deviants of Damascus." Abu Dharr said, "What do I have to do with the deviants of Damascus and how would I know them?" His son Bilal said, "I will write them," so he wrote them. Abu Dharr said, "How do you know? You would only know that they are deviants if you were one of them. Begin with yourself and do not send their names."

2312880.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312880
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 010
2312880.text: 'Abdul-'Aziz ibn Qays said, "I visited 'Abdullah ibn 'Umar while a slavegirl was shaving his hair." He said, "The limestone depilatory makes the skin supple."

2312890.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312890
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 011
2312890.text: circumcision, shaving the pubic hair, plucking the armpits, clipping the moustache and clipping the nails."

2312900.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312900
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 012
2312900.text: circumcision, shaving the pubic hair, clipping the nails, plucking the armpits, and clipping the moustache."

2312920.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312920
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 014
2312920.text: Abu't-Tufayl reported, "I saw the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, divide the meat at al-Ji'rana. At that time, I was a boy who carried the joint of the camel (after it had been sacrificed). A woman came to him and he spread out his robe for her. I asked, 'Who is this?' The reply was, 'This is the woman who suckled him.'"

2312930.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312930
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 015
2312930.text: Al-Mughira ibn Shu'ba reported that a man said, "May Allah make the amir thrive! Your chamberlain recognises certain men and gives them preference in permission to enter." He said, "May Allah excuse him! Recognition is beneficial (dealing) with a vicious dog and attacking camel."

2312940.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312940
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 016
2312940.text: Ibrahim said, "Our companions used to allow us all sorts of play things except for dogs."

2312950.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312950
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 017
2312950.text: Abu 'Uqba said, "I once walked along the road with Ibn 'Umar. I passed some Abyssinian lads who were playing and he brought out two dirhams which he gave to them."

2312960.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312960
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 018
2312960.text: 'A'isha reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to call her companions to her who were playing with dolls."

2312970.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312970
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 019
2312970.text: Abu Hurayra said, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, saw a man following a dove and said, 'A shaytan following a shaytan.'"

2312980.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312980
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 020
2312980.text: Al-Hasan said, "'Uthman did not speak on any Jumu'a without commanding the killing of dogs and slaughtering of doves."

2312990.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312990
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 021
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 021
2312990.text: Zayd ibn Thabit reported that 'Umar ibn al-Khattab came to him to ask to see him one day and he gave him permission while his head was in the hands of a slavegirl of his who was combing his hair. He removed his head and 'Umar said to him, 'Let her comb it.' He said, 'Amir al-Mu'minin, if you were to send for me, I would come to you.' ''Umar said, 'It is my need.'"

2313000.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313000
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 022
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 022
2313000.text: Abu Hurayra said, "When someone spits in the presence of people, let him catch it with his palms so that his spit does not fall on the ground. When he fasts, he should oil his palm so that the trace of the fast is not seen on him."

2313010.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2313010
In-book reference  : Book 55, Hadith 023
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 55, Hadith 023
2313010.text: Habib ibn Abi Thabit said, "When a man spoke, they used to like that he not turn to one particular man, but rather he should address everyone."
